title: Release notes
content:
This incremental release of Service Management introduces new features and enhancements, in addition to defect fixes.

Aviator updates

  • Model Upgrade: The Llama model has been replaced with Gemma to improve performance and accuracy.
  • Language Detection: Issues in the previous language detection library have been resolved by implementing LLM based detection for better reliability. The model type appears as Gemma only when Service Management is set to 26.1.
  • Logging: Tenant level logging is now enabled to improve monitoring and troubleshooting.

    Service Management updates

    Configure Azure internal load balancer for Service Management and UCMDB communication

    Enhance security and optimize performance with our new capability to configure an Azure Internal Load Balancer (ILB) for Helm-based deployments. This feature enables seamless internal communication between Service Management (SM) and containerized UD/UCMDB on Azure, while isolating integration traffic from external access. By maintaining a clear separation between internal and external channels, you can ensure secure, reliable, and efficient operations for your enterprise deployments. For more information, see Configure the application gateway for UD/UCMDB - Service Management.

    Portal entity filters

    This release introduces portal entity filters, which allow administrators to control the records self-service portal users can view for each entity type. These filters work alongside rendering-rule filters to determine the data shown in the portal UI. Out-of-the-box portal entity filters are available for the Customer Service Management (CSM) entity types Entitlement, Environment, and Product Instance.
    For more information, see Portal entity filters.

    Number formatting option

    The Number Formatting option determines the display of numeric values in the application. When this option is enabled in Application Settings, numbers in Integer and Double data types are formatted for better readability, such as displaying 1,000 instead of 1000. Users can also control number formatting at the field level in Studio and User Options. This setting also affects upgrade behavior and governs how formatting is applied to new fields, entity fields, and option fields. For more information, see Number Formatting.

    Platform updates

    RLAC: Support for users with more than 250 groups

    Record Level Access Control (RLAC) now supports users with up to 500 group memberships, delivering unmatched scalability and reliability for even the most complex organizations.

    Benefits:

    • Increased group limit: RLAC fully supports users with more than 250 and up to 500 groups
    • Improved scalability: Handles complex organizational structures without performance degradation.
    • Enhanced reliability: Eliminates previous access control issues caused by group limits.

    For more information, see Configuring RLAC.

    Use external data in user options

    You can now use external data dynamic options to populate dropdown fields with real-time data from external systems. This feature allows users to select current values from third-party systems when creating or updating records.

    Benefits:

    • Real-time data: Access up-to-date values at the moment of selection.
    • Seamless integration: Connect to any external data source via Integration Studio.
    • Enhanced user experience: Fast, searchable dropdowns with up to 1,000 displayed items.
    For more details, see Use external data in user options.

    Restrict/allow attachments

    A new Restrict/allow attachments rule is available to administrators. This rule enables you to:

    • Restrict or allow uploading or deleting attachments in specific fields, such as Attachments or rich text fields (e.g., comments, descriptions).
    • Apply user-defined conditions for attachment handling.

    Key characteristics of this business rule:

    • Appears under Rendering rules in both Studio and User Options.
    • Applies across Service Portal, Agent Interface, and Mobile App UI.
    • Does not impact the ability to view or download attachments.

    For more details, see Rendering rule examples.

    Edit or delete system comments

    Tenant administrators can now edit or delete system comments within Service Management. This enhancement provides greater flexibility and control over comment management. For more details, see Discussions.

    Integration Studio

    • Integration Studio Hardening: Integration Studio now displays Last Modified By and Last Modified Time in the UI, providing clear visibility at both integration and scenario levels for better tracking and collaboration. For details, see Create an integration and Add and configure scenarios sections in Use the Integration Studio - Service Management.
    • Import and Export: Starting with 26.1 release, you can seamlessly import integration packages exported from version 25.2 and later. For details, see Export and import integrations - Service Management.
    • Endpoint Management Integration: You can now integrate Endpoint Management with Service Management. This integration allows you to import devices from Endpoint Management into UCMDB and the SACM module. For details, see Integration Studio - Endpoint Management - Service Management.
    • Microsoft Teams Integration: MS Teams Channel Notification v2 leverages Integration Studio to give you greater flexibility in configuration. You can design and send custom adaptive cards directly to your MS Teams channels. For details, see Teams channel notification v2.

      Mobile updates

      • Self-signed SSL certificates for iOS now require installation through a mobile configuration profile. This change ensures secure communication and compliance with mobile device security standards.
      • Added support for Restrict/allow attachments rule for both iOS and Android devices
      • Added support for external data in user options for both iOS and Android devices
      See the mobile app documents for details.

      Automation Center

      Security and compliance content updates

      The following sections list the compliance benchmarks: 

      • CIS Benchmark for Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server 10 (beta). 

      • CIS Benchmark for Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server 9 v. 2.0.0.

      Cloud Management

      • Support for GCP cloud cost reporting using the Operations Orchestration workflow-based collector.

      • Support for AWX (open-source Ansible Automation Platform) to deploy resources using Ansible playbooks through OO content.

      Support matrix updates

      Added support 

      • PostgreSQL 17.x

      • React library 19.x 

      • Mobile: Android 16, iOS 26

      K8s support changes 

      • EKS: 1.32, 1.33
      • AKS: 1.32, 1.33
      • GCP: 1.32, 1.33
      • OpenShift: 4.17, 4.18, 4.19, 4.20

      OO Containerized support changes 

      • Upgraded Apache Tomcat to 10.1.49
      • Upgraded Java to 17.0.17-17.62.17 
      • Upgraded Spring Boot to 3.5.6 
      • Upgraded RabbitMQ to 5.26.0
      • Upgraded Liquibase to 4.33.0
      • HTTP Client upgraded to 5.5.1 
      • Added support for Windows Server 2025 for remote presence components (OO Workflow Designer and External RAS)

      Related topics
